title: NFI 2012 water budgets and drought stress indicators database
author: Schmidt-Walter; Paul; Ahrends; Bernd; Mette; Tobias; Puhlmann; Heike; Meesenburg; Henning
description: The NFIWADS database contributes results from process-based water balance simulations with the hydrological model LWF-BROOK90 to the plots of the German National Forest Inventory (NFI). Using the climate and soil data from the databases "NFI 2012 environmental data base climate" and "NFI 2012 environmental data base site unit and characteristic soil profile" from the project “Forest roductivity, carbon sequestration, climate change”, more than 150 water budget, soil moisture, and drought stress indicators were derived for standardised beech and spruce stands. The data cover a retrospective period (1961-2013) and three climate change projections (2011-2050) based on MPI ESM ECHAM6 RCP scenarios (2.6, 4.5, 8.5) simulated with the STARS model. The database contains monthly, seasonal, and yearly water budget, soil moisture, and drought stress indicators.
text:
[Forschungsdaten](https://www.openagrar.de/servlets/solr/find?condQuery=*&fq=category.top:%22mir_genres:research_data%22%20AND%20(state%3Apublished+OR+createdby%3Aguest)) [CC BY 4.0](https://www.openagrar.de/servlets/solr/find?condQuery=*&fq=link:*cc_by_4.0&owner=createdby:guest)
NFI 2012 water budgets and drought stress indicators database
The NFIWADS database contributes results from process-based water balance simulations with the hydrological model LWF-BROOK90 to the plots of the German National Forest Inventory (NFI). Using the climate and soil data from the databases "NFI 2012 environmental data base climate" and "NFI 2012 environmental data base site unit and characteristic soil profile" from the project “Forest roductivity, carbon sequestration, climate change”, more than 150 water budget, soil moisture, and drought stress indicators were derived for standardised beech and spruce stands. The data cover a retrospective period (1961-2013) and three climate change projections (2011-2050) based on MPI ESM ECHAM6 RCP scenarios (2.6, 4.5, 8.5) simulated with the STARS model. The database contains monthly, seasonal, and yearly water budget, soil moisture, and drought stress indicators.
Die BWI Umweltdatenbank Wasserhaushalt und Trockenstress liefert Ergebnisse von prozess-basierten Wasserhaushaltssimulationen mit dem hydrologischen Modell LWF-BROOK90 für die Punkte der Bundeswaldinventur in Deutschland (BWI). Mithilfe der BWI Umweltdatenbanken "Klima" und "Standortseinheit und Leitprofil" des Projekts "Waldproduktivität und Kohlenstoffspeicherung im Klimawandel" wurden mehr als 150 Kennwerte zu Wasserflüssen, Bodenfeuchte und Trockenstress für standisierte Buchen- und Fichtenbestände berechnet. Diese decken einen retrospektiven Zeitraum (1961-2013) und drei Klimawandelprojektionen (2011-2050) ab. Die Klimawandelprojektionen basieren auf MPI ESM ECHAM6 RCP Szenarien (2.6, 4.5, 8.5), und wurden mit dem STARS-Modell simuliert. Die Datenbank enthält monatliche, saisonale und jährliche Kennwerte zu Wasserhaushalt und Trockenstress.
